name: blunderer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who makes a lot of serious mistakes, usually because of not taking care: The chief constable is seen by some as a blunderer. We should be blaming the incompetent blunderers who got us into this mess in the first place. See
blunder
More examplesFewer examplesBilly is a silly, insensitive old blunderer.Who do this bunch of blunderers think they're kidding?We had to helplessly watch as these blunderers threw the game away.
